item.title: Brenda add a quote by Ana Castillo
item.description: "There’s something insupportable about being pissed with the one person on this planet that sends your adrenaline flowing to remind you that you’re alive. It’s almost like we’re mad because we’ve been shocked out of our usual comatose state of being by feeling something for someone, for ourselves, for just a moment." -- Ana Castillo

item.title: Brenda add a quote by Ana Castillo
item.description: "What you perceive as "liberal" is my independence to choose what i do, with whom, and when. Moreover, it also means that i may choose not to do it, with anyone, ever." -- Ana Castillo

item.title: Brenda add a quote by Ana Castillo
item.description: "Catch me, as if I have surely been out committing a violation against you, my sin of insisting on existing without you. " -- Ana Castillo

item.title: Brenda add a quote by Ana Castillo
item.description: "something about giving himself over to a woman was worse than having lunch with the devil..." -- Ana Castillo

item.title: Brenda add a quote by Marianne Williamson
item.description: "...available people are the ones who are dangerous, because they confront us with the possibility of real intimacy." -- Marianne Williamson

item.title: Brenda add a quote by Marianne Williamson
item.description: "It takes courage...to endure the sharp pains of self discovery rather than choose to take the dull pain of unconsciousness that would last the rest of our lives." -- Marianne Williamson

item.title: Brenda add a quote by Richard Bach
item.description: "I do not exist to impress the world. I exist to live my life in a way that will make me happy. " -- Richard Bach

item.title: Brenda add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "When I had nothing to lose, I had everything. When I stopped being who I am, I found myself." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Brenda add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Profound desire, true desire is the desire to be close to someone." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Brenda add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "All my life, I thought of love as some kind of voluntary enslavement. Well, that's a lie: freedom only exists when love is present. The person who gives him or herself wholly, the person who feels freest, is the person who loves most wholeheartedly." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Brenda add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "You must be the person you have never had the courage to be. Gradually, you will discover that you are that person, but until you can see this clearly, you must pretend and invent." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Brenda add a quote by Khalil Gibran
item.description: "For even as love crowns you so shall he crucify you. Even as he is for your growth so is he for your pruning. Even as he ascends to your height and caresses your tenderest branches that quiver in the sun, so shall he descend to your roots and shake them in their clinging to the earth." -- Khalil Gibran

item.title: Brenda add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "Freeing yourself was one thing, claiming ownership of that freed self was another." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Brenda add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "She is a friend of my mind. She gather me, man. The pieces I am, she gather them and give them back to me in all the right order." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Brenda add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "behind the mask of ice that people wear, there beats a heart of fire." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Brenda add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "she wanted to dance with someone who would embrace her in the way she dreamed of since adolescence." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Brenda add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Of all the ways we have found to hurt ourselves, the worse has been through love. We are always suffering because of someone who doesn't love us, or someone who has left us, or someone who won't leave us. If we are alone, it is because no one wants us..." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Brenda add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "We always have a tendency to see those things that do not exist and to be blind to the great lessons that are right there before our eyes." -- Paulo Coelho
